H0.text: Metal is the material that best conducts heat and electricity.

H1.text: Plastic is the material that best conducts heat and electricity.

H2.text: Rubber is the material that best conducts heat and electricity.

H3.text: Wood is the material that best conducts heat and electricity.

A4.text: The elemental metals have electrical conductivity values of from 6.9 × 103 S/cm for manganese to 6.3 × 105 S/cm for silver.

A5.text: In contrast, a semiconducting metalloid such as boron has an electrical conductivity 1.5 × 10−6 S/cm.
